subject: Re: [junit] About the value of JUnit
msgSnippet: I will confess to be partial, but from what I ve seen TDD/JUnit will make you very productive if you can develop the disciple needed to use this approach. I
messageBody:
I will confess to be partial, but from what I've seen TDD/JUnit will make
you very productive if you can develop the disciple needed to use this
approach. I have not used JTest, but I do not see it as a substitute.
Regards,
David

----- Original Message -----
From: "javainsel" <javainsel@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, April 03, 2003 9:56 AM
Subject: [junit] About the value of JUnit


> I am not working for Parasoft and I am completely serious.
>
> So don't assert false about me.
>
> JTest sounds very good to me, and I will test whether it will help
> our team to be more productive than using JUnit instead.
>
> This article is very interesting:
> http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-03-2001/jw-0323-lw-jtest.html
>
> No, I'm not the author of that article!
>
>
>
